title: Only FloatTensor has docstrings
body_html:
Steps to repro:

>>> help(torch.FloatTensor())                                                                                                 
>>> help(torch.DoubleTensor())

This doesn't seem good. Is there a good reason we didn't attach docs to everything? I think it would be a simple matter of modifying torch/_tensor_docs.py to loop over all types (you'd also want to NOT add the docstring if the method doesn't exist). CC @apaszke who originally added docstring support.

>>> help(torch.DoubleTensor())

body:
Steps to repro:

```
>>> help(torch.FloatTensor())                                                                                                 
>>> help(torch.DoubleTensor())
```

This doesn't seem good. Is there a good reason we didn't attach docs to everything? I think it would be a simple matter of modifying `torch/_tensor_docs.py` to loop over all types (you'd also want to NOT add the docstring if the method doesn't exist). CC @apaszke who originally added docstring support.
